meanings.definition: To unwind or release something from a spool or reel.
meanings.sent1: She unspools the thread carefully from the spool.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic unspools the wire from the reel to fix the machine.
meanings.sent3: As she unspools the ribbon, it seems to go on forever!
meanings.sent4: The magician unspools the scarf, creating a mesmerizing effect.
meanings.sent5: The movie unspools its credits, signaling the end of the film.

meanings.definition: To reveal or unfold gradually, as a story or narrative.
meanings.sent1: The mystery novel unspools its plot twists one by one.
meanings.sent2: The documentary unspools the history of the ancient civilization.
meanings.sent3: The gossip column unspools juicy details about the celebrity scandal.
meanings.sent4: Her life story unspools like a never-ending reel of film.
meanings.sent5: The map unspools the hidden treasures of the lost city.
